What is the best vncserver? (!best I kno: does it have to be vnc
pros/cons of each of those compared to vnc?
NX creates a new X session for each connection so it is not useful if you want the server side to see what is going on
X11 is the same but only forwards the app that you start instead of the entire X session
I think vnc is a better option for what I want
is the server on a windows or *nix OS?
server is ubuntu hardy, client will be xp/arch lappy, possibly other various xp/vista machines
I was wanting to set it up so only localhost could view tunneled over ssh2
if the server is *nix i would use tightvnc
for a windows client/server i would use ultravnc
any specific reason or just personal preferences?
tight has better compression so better speeds ..... ultra has lots of extra tools like file copying and chat etc as well as the extra compression
Ok, thanks, I'll try those out
if your looking to just work on a home computer from away i would highly recommend X11 forwarding
you can do X11 forwarding on windows using XMing
